statement.tex: %text Find the angle between the vectors $\ora{a}=\vector{1}{-1}{1}$ and $\ora{b}=\vector{1}{1}{-1}$. %

step.context: %text If $\ora{a}$ and $\ora{b}$ are two vectors such that $\theta$ is the angle between them, what is $\ora{a}\cdot \ora{b}-\ora{b}\cdot \ora{a}$? %
step.reason: %text The dot product of two vectors is projection (or perpendicular) of one vector on the other, times the other or vica-versa. If two vectors $\ora{a}$ and $\ora{b}$ have angle $\theta$ between them, % \begin{align} \ora{a}\cdot \ora{b}&=|\ora{a}|\cos\theta\times|\ora{b}| =|\ora{a}||\ora{b}|\cos\theta \\ \ora{b}\cdot \ora{a}&=|\ora{b}|\cos\theta\times|\ora{a}| =|\ora{a}||\ora{b}|\cos\theta \\ \end{align}
